architectural_notes: Backend authorization is implemented via Motoko modules backend/authorization/access-control.mo and backend/authorization/MixinAuthorization.mo; main.mo depends on them and they must define required functions for canister initialization.
Authorization model should use role-based access control with roles: admin, editor, viewer.
known_issues: Backend canister stops/traps on startup because authorization modules (access-control.mo and MixinAuthorization.mo) are empty/missing required functions; backend configuration/health check fails.

new_feature_requests.summary: Regenerate backend authorization modules (access-control.mo and MixinAuthorization.mo) implementing admin/editor/viewer role-based authorization so the canister compiles and starts

Create valid, non-empty Motoko implementations for the missing authorization modules at `backend/authorization/access-control.mo` and `backend/authorization/MixinAuthorization.mo` so the backend canister compiles and no longer traps on initialization.

Implement role-based authorization using the confirmed role structure: admin, editor, viewer. Ensure the authorization API matches how `backend/main.mo` calls it (e.g., `AccessControl.initState()`, `AccessControl.hasPermission(state, caller, #admin)`, `AccessControl.hasPermission(state, caller, #user)`, and `AccessControl.isAdmin(state, caller)`), and ensure `include MixinAuthorization(accessControlState);` composes correctly in `backend/main.mo`.

Ensure the authorization state is safely initialized and persistent across upgrades where applicable, following the projectâ€™s single-actor architecture (all Motoko logic in `backend/main.mo`) and without introducing additional backend services.

projectName: Regenerate backend authorization modules to stop canister crash
